columns.Description: Date and time when the record was generated
columns.Name: Timestamp

columns.Description: Type of activity that triggered the event
columns.Name: ActionType

columns.Description: Application that performed the recorded action
columns.Name: Application

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the application
columns.Name: ApplicationId

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the instance of an application
columns.Name: AppInstanceId

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the account in Microsoft Entra ID
columns.Name: AccountObjectId

columns.Description: An identifier for the account as found by Microsoft Cloud App Security. Could be Microsoft Entra ID, user principal name, or other identifiers.
columns.Name: AccountId

columns.Description: Name displayed in the address book entry for the account user. This is usually a combination of the given name, middle initial, and surname of the user.
columns.Name: AccountDisplayName

columns.Description: Indicates whether the activity was performed by an administrator
columns.Name: IsAdminOperation

columns.Description: Type of device based on purpose and functionality, such as network device, workstation, server, mobile, gaming console, or printer
columns.Name: DeviceType

columns.Description: Platform of the operating system running on the device. This indicates specific operating systems, including variations within the same family, such as Windows 10 and Windows 7
columns.Name: OSPlatform

columns.Description: IP address assigned to the device during communication
columns.Name: IPAddress

columns.Description: Indicates whether the IP address belongs to a known anonymous proxy
columns.Name: IsAnonymousProxy

columns.Description: Two-letter code indicating the country where the client IP address is geolocated
columns.Name: CountryCode

columns.Description: City where the client IP address is geolocated
columns.Name: City

columns.Description: Internet service provider associated with  the IP address
columns.Name: ISP

columns.Description: User agent information from the web browser or other client application
columns.Name: UserAgent

columns.Description: Type of activity that triggered the event
columns.Name: ActivityType

columns.Description: List of objects, such as files or folders, that were involved in the recorded activity
columns.Name: ActivityObjects

columns.Description: Name of the object that the recorded action was applied to
columns.Name: ObjectName

columns.Description: The type of object, such as a file or a folder, that the recorded action was applied to
columns.Name: ObjectType

columns.Description: Unique identifier of the object that the recorded action was applied to
columns.Name: ObjectId

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the event
columns.Name: ReportId

columns.Description: Type of user account, indicating its general role and access levels, such as Regular, System, Admin, Application
columns.Name: AccountType

columns.Description: Indicates whether a user inside the network does not belong to the organization’s domain
columns.Name: IsExternalUser

columns.Description: Indicates whether the activity was performed by one user on behalf of another (impersonated) user
columns.Name: IsImpersonated

columns.Description: Customer-defined information applied to specific IP addresses and IP address ranges
columns.Name: IPTags

columns.Description: Additional information about the IP address
columns.Name: IPCategory

columns.Description: More information provided by Microsoft Cloud App Security in a tag in the user agent field. Can have any of the following values: Native client, Outdated browser, Outdated operating system, Robot
columns.Name: UserAgentTags

columns.Description: Raw event information from the source application or service in JSON format
columns.Name: RawEventData

columns.Description: Additional information about the entity or event
columns.Name: AdditionalFields

columns.Description: Session identifiers (if provided by the audit source)
columns.Name: SessionData

columns.Description: Cloud enviorment source of the cloud audit event. Cloud be Azure, AWS, GCP, AliCloud or other
columns.Name: AuditSource

columns.Description: A unique identifier that's assigned to an application when it’s registered to Entra with OAuth 2.0.
columns.Name: OAuthAppId

columns.Description: List of features observed to be statistically uncommon for the user that performed the activity
columns.Name: UncommonForUser

columns.Description: Number of days since each statistical feature for the user was last seen
columns.Name: LastSeenForUser
